settings.headline: EVERY PAIR OF VERMONT GLOVES ARE MADE IN OUR RANDOLPH, VERMONT FACTORY.

settings.text:
You can't get leather without ruminants. Sorry to break it to ya, but it's just one of those things.

Goats that live on pasture year round make the rugged hides that we prize for their leather's durability and longevity.
settings.button_text: Learn why we use goat leather

settings.subhead: WE ARE GUIDED BY THE THREE Q'S: QUALITY, QUALITY AND QUALITY
settings.text: Once the goat hides are shipped from the pasture to our factory, we gauge the thickness of every single one. The thicker the leather, the more durable and the less pliable it is. We use the different thicknesses for different parts of your glove.

First, we mark out every defect so can cut it out. Then, we lay out each one of the 24 pieces that make up a Vermonter glove in the correct location on the hide.

Every part of a goat hide stretches in a different direction. We make every piece of the glove is cut from the right part of the hide so it works like it's sposeda.

settings.title: (Image) All pieces of Vermonter laid out on table
